histmgr::HistMgr

histmgr::HistMgr Class Reference

Manages lists of histograms which can be written to prior assigned files. More...

Detailed Description

Manages lists of histograms which can be written to prior assigned files.

lcio::LCCollection * histmgr::HistMgr::create2DHistograms ( const Key_t &  group_key,
const Key_t &  collection_key,
const EVENT::StringVec &  name_list,
const lcio::IntVec &  n_hist_list,
const HistPar &  x_par,
const HistPar &  y_par,
bool  may_overwrite = false 
) throw (std::bad_alloc, std::runtime_error)

create 2D array of histograms which will all have the same binning and the same name (except of a numeric extension).

To create an array of 2x3 histograms lcio::IntVec index index.push_back(3) index.push_back(3) histmgr::Key_t hist_arr_2d_key("hist_arr_2d") histogramList->createHistograms(group_key,hist_arr_2d_key,index,HistPar(4,-.5,.5)); The histograms are only written to a file if the histogram group, to which this histogram belongs, is assigned to a file (histmgr::HistMgr::assignFileName).

Parameters:
group_key the name of the group this histogram belongs to
collection_key name of the collection to which the histogram belongs
name_list a vector containing the names of the histograms whose length is either one or equals the number of elements of n_hist_list
n_hist_list an array of histograms per major index
x_par the binning of the x-axis of the histogram
y_par the binning of the y-axis the histogram
may_overwrite flag to overwrite or not the histogram (default: false)
Returns:
the index of the first histogram for

create 2D array of histograms which will all have the same binning and the same name (except of a numeric extension).

The histograms are only written to a file if the histogram group, to which this histogram belongs, is assigned to a file (histmgr::HistMgr::assignFileName).

create several histograms which will have the same binning and the same name (except of a numeric extension).

The histograms are only written to a file if the histogram group, to which this histogram belongs, is assigned to a file (histmgr::HistMgr::assignFileName).

Parameters:
group_key the name of the group this histogram belongs to
collection_key the name of the histogram collection
name_list a vector containing the names of the histograms whose length is either equals n_hist or is zero. In the latter case the collection name is used for the all histograms.
n_hist the number of histograms to be created
x_par the binning of the x-axis of the histogram
y_par the binning of the y-axis of the histogram
may_overwrite flag to overwrite or not the histogram, if already existing (default: false)
Returns:
the index of the first histogram for

Definition at line 425 of file HistMgr.hh.

Referenced by create2DHistograms(), and CALICE::SquareFinder::init().

lcio::LCCollection * histmgr::HistMgr::createGraphCollection ( const Key_t &  group_key,
const Key_t &  collection_key,
unsigned int  n_graphs,
const EVENT::StringVec &  type_names,
unsigned int  n_expected_values,
const EVENT::StringVec &  opt_major_names,
bool  may_overwrite = false 
) throw (std::bad_alloc, std::runtime_error)

Create a collection of graphs.

The graphs are addressed by a major and a minor index. The graph collection can for example be used to create mean, rms, min,max graphs per module. The following parameters can be supplied to the collection:

  • minor_width : a vector which contains the width for each minor index of the line to be drawn.
  • minor_style : a vector which contains the style for each minor index used to draw the line.
  • minor_color : a vector which contains the color for each minor index used to draw the line.
  • major_color : a vector which contains the color for each major index used to draw the line. This color has precedence over the minor_color

void histmgr::HistMgr::createHistogramGroup ( const Key_t &  group_key  )  [inline]

Create an empty histogram group to which histograms can be assigned.

Parameters:
group_key the key to address the group
Returns:
ID assigned to the group of the given name The group name is uniqe. If the group exists already the id of the existing group is returned.

void histmgr::HistMgr::fillHistogramCollectionList ( const Key_t &  group_key,
ECollectionType  type,
std::vector< std::string > &  dest_histogram_collection_list 
) const

Copy the histogram collection names of the specified group to the given vector.

Parameters:
group_key the name of the group whose histogram collection are considered.
type type of the collection to which the histogram belongs
dest_histogram_collection_list the vector which will be filled with the names of the histgram collections which are associated to the specified group. First the given vector will be cleared. Then all the names of the histogram collections which are associated to the specfied group will be copied to it.

FloatHistogram2D* histmgr::HistMgr::get2DHistogram ( const Key_t &  group_key,
const Key_t &  hist_key,
UInt_t  major_index,
UInt_t  minor_index 
) [inline]

get a 2D histogram of the collection which is organised as a two dimensional array.

The histogram must not be deleted. Generally, the method does not check the validity of the indices. the method throws exceptions if the collection does not exist or If BOUNDARY_CHECK is defined and the indices are out of range.

Parameters:
group_key name of the histogram's group
hist_key name of the histogram
major_index the major index within the collection
minor_index the major index within the collection
Returns:
pointer to the histogram collection or zero.

Definition at line 901 of file HistMgr.hh.

void histmgr::HistMgr::lockGroup ( const Key_t &  group_key  )  [inline]

Lock a histogram group.

If a group is locked it will not be deleted until the lock is released.

See also:
unlockGroup

void histmgr::HistMgr::unlockGroup ( const Key_t &  group_key  )

If a group is locked it will not be deleted until the lock is released.
